title: What if there were Training Dummies that move in a line?
body: That would help with aiming at a moving target. It could be like a dummy on wheels sent at a certain direction. That'd be neat.

replies.body: Hmm, that sounds like it's got potential to me at least. I don't work on or regularly with the team that's building Practice Tool, I'll pass the suggestion on to them though!

@Meddler, I think training mode need dummies that keep shooting skill-shots at a straight line for us to test itemization for tanks and bruisers, could have 4 variations: 

* AD variation with 1 sec CD per skillshot ( test dps, and dps reduction when building defensive items ) 

* AD variation with burst skill-shots ( A huge dmg one or burst of the variation 1 ) with 5 sec CD so we can process the numbers.

* AP variation similar to the first.

* AP beam with constant dps ( maybe 2 or 4 ticks per sec ).

__________________________________

Does Riot plan to add the ability to change champion's stats, skills, and multiplayer in the training mode? I think we (players) can come up with fresh ideias to help the balance team in the future, giving feedback with visual representation of a solution could be valuable, don't you think?

Disclaimer: I know the objective with the training tool is to train the mechanics of the game, but I think with minor changes could also become much more.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EDIT: Could even be a huge {{champion:58}} head-like structure.

http://imgur.com/a/Ur2W0

Ooo Ooo !!

Can I suggest to be able to change the dummies' Armor / MR as well?

I want to see how much dmg I do on squishies and tanks.

because in real life your enemies **don't **move in a line.
This can only lead to bad habits

Wait what?
All movements are in a line. Sure, there is sometimes juking or alternate movement patterns involved, but most of the time the enemies move in a direction to avoid you. They don't just stand still; if anything a static dummy would cause the bad habits. The habits that this would lead to is ability timing and movement tracking.
